Reviews.Title: “Good hotel with great staff”
Reviews.Author: JMacL0nd0n
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located a little way out of town but it made up for it in value for money. We stayed three nights and had a small twin room on the 4th floor but it was really clean and included wifi access, BBC, and there's a gym. The staff were incredibly helpful and its very easy to get a bus into town, it takes about 15/20 minutes and the stop is a 5/10min walk away near all the shops. Don't believe taxi drivers who tell you its a long way out of town, we had that experience at the airport and after getting the train into Termini, our taxi ride was around €10, late on a friday night. The hotel was really great and I would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “My four nights in Rome”
Reviews.Author: NIGEL M Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Had a super time in Rome, and enjoyed the hotel. Highlights include the breakfast, great range, really tasty and can eat as much as you want. For me it was the fuel for the day and i didnt eat til dinner - great for making the most of your days. The breakfast room is pleasant. Another highlight is the staff who seemed happy in their jobs and always helpful and efficient. I was v happy in my single room. Its a small room with a big bed and very decent. Safe was useful for sense of security. Always appreciate a kettle in the room. Overall, in march at 60 odd euros, good value. Location might be an issue for some. I liked it, being about a mile and a half from the centre and in a very nice suburban area. I enjoyed jumping on the bus. Scary finding it on my first night without any italian - taxi would have been safer.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Peak District National Park, United Kingdom
Reviews.Title: “Everything was just as expected!”
Reviews.Author: deeredriverone
Reviews.Content: We stayed here at the start of March 2012 for a long weekend break. The Hotel was just as described on the website, which for us was perfect. It was a 35 minute walk into the city or a shorter walk around the corner to the bus stop. The staff were lovely and very helpfull, booking us into a local restaurant every night and organising a very good airport transfer. We upgraded when we booked online to the Superior rooms and it was lovely with a comfortable bed, huge tv, Jacuzzi bath and was very clean and tidy throughout. Our room faced away from the busy road so was lovely and quiet throughout our stay and the buffet style breakfast was spot on for setting you up for the morning. We didnt spend that much time at the hotel as Rome is a must see city, but we enjoyed our time there and would certainly come back if we got the chance. Thanks to all at the Hotel Panama Garden for making our trip so special!

Reviews.Title: “Pluses and Minuses”
Reviews.Author: agathos
Reviews.Content: Pluses: In a pleasant residential area off the tourist track. Very well run, with helpful staff. A good restaurant about quarter of a mile away. When we complained about our impossibly small "standard" bedroom, we were upgraded without charge to a spacious and quiet room. The receptionists provide helpful information on local bus and tram routes. Breakfast is included. Minuses: It is far from the centre, which involves a crowded bus ride, usually standing all the way. Tabacchi which sell bus tickets do not stock the 3-day all-in tickets which at 11euros are the best value. You need to go to a train or metro station for these. Breakfast is not inspiring - we found the fresh Greek yoghourt in ice the best bet, with a honey portion. The toasters are efficient once you get the hang of their old-fashioned design. You need to factor in an extra 100 euros to get to and from the airport (booking a taxi through the hotel) - a huge 140 if you don't.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: kmkmkm10
Reviews.Content: Super helpful staff, room was clean and tidy. Location was a bit of a trek and had to get a bus in to the centre every day, but quite managable. Would stay again for realiability factor. Bed was a little hard, but who cares when you're having fun in Rome :)

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't fault it!”
Reviews.Author: craig-mccart
Reviews.Content: Me and my partner went to Rome for the first time for a Valentines break, and was recommended this by Avios as it was the same price as a 3 star hotel. The room: Very clean, warm considering it had snowed, but no English TV channels so glad of the laptop (to be expected in Italy), had a shower, everything was as expected. The staff: all very friendly, very willing to help, even gave me a phone charger as there was no travel adapter for mine. The food: The breakfast consisted of croosoints, toast, cereal, yoghurts, fruit, and various spreads, this was the only thing I found, there could have been more variety, still, filled a hole. Location: There was a 10/15 minute walk to the bus stop, once there it was 1 Euro per person, but me and my Fiancee did struggle... Note---unless you know some Italian we didn't really know how the bus worked, there is a ticket machine on the bus which you place a Euro in to print a ticket, on the ticket was a time, but nothing to say if it was a return or anything. Back to the hotel though, overall we were happy with the hotel, and would stay again, couldn't really complain at all.

Reviews.Title: “staff are bellisimo!”
Reviews.Author: NOUNTAIN
Reviews.Content: really small but comfortable room with a large balcony, tiny lift or lots of stars but I have to say we found this a very nice and relatively well placed hotel. good bus service into and out of the city centre once you have figured out how it works. Good continental breakfast and very attentative staff, thank you

Reviews.Title: “nice & cozy!”
Reviews.Author: Anna_K_12887
Reviews.Content: We stayed one week in January 2012. I booked this hotel based on good reviews and it was totally worth it! I thought the hotel was very Italian-like. All of the staff were helpful and kind. The location, for me, was excellent! I enjoy walking and it takes only ~20mins to walk to the center. Also a bus stop is right around the corner. A single way ticket, valid for 75mins, costs 1€. Taxi costs ~10€ from the center/termini train station to the hotel. A normal taxi from the airport was like 70€ to the hotel, so when I left I used hotels own airport-taxi which cost 45€. I'd suggest using that if you want an easy transportation. You need to pay in cash to the driver. Our room was small but cozy and clean. We had a lovely balcony and a bathroom that was big and clean. A safety box didn't work but we had no use for it anyway. The room was definitely not soundproof, but there wasn't any street noise and everything else we heard was on reasonable hours. I'd more likely to be sorry for our neighbors. Wi-fi worked fine but only on one machine at a time. You need to ask for a password from the reception. Also ask for the nearest restaurant, it was one of the best! I could easily stay another time here!

Reviews.Title: “Very good, a bit small”
Reviews.Author: Januz66
Reviews.Content: I stayed one night and I booked few days in advance finding a very cheap fares. I've found a very nice structure, a friendly staff, right in the Parioli neighbourhood. The room was nice but I understood immediately the reason of the cheap rate: it was slightly larger than the bed itself. Good enough anyway for a solo stay overnight.

Reviews.Title: “A Stay a Dream!”
Reviews.Author: Erik B
Reviews.Content: My family and I, stayed in Hotel Panama Garden for 5 nights during our long weekend trip to Rome for my father anniversary in December ..What can we say?? We had a wonderful stay!! We stayde in 2 rooms one triple and one double. Also if the room were not too big they were very confortable.. In our room there was a safe in and fantastic free wi-fi . The breakfast was very good and various with fresh juices and a delicious salted home made cake that really tasted italian. The location of the hotel was perfect for us ! A little out of the city but very easy to reach the city centre. The hotel is very homely, the 2 rooms had everything that we needed. We also had a balcony that was very useful for our little doggy . The bathroom was niceand very clean . What we aslo found very useful was the new Gym in the hotel completely free . The staff was absolutely nice and always smiling . Every day going out and coming back we found a smile waiting for us..that helped us to feel home. All were wonderful and always ready to help us in all our request. Thank you so much to the tall man with glasses,to Naoemi,to the asiatic guy to all the staff in the breakfast room and to the manager , We cannot remember her name but she was a nice girl very professional with a beautiful white doggy that we loved. Thank you to all. Had an all round lovely trip, it was the perfect birthday present and when we return to Rome, which I'm sure we will, we'd definitely stay at Panama again. Stayed October 2011, travelled as a couple Value Location Sleep Quality Rooms Cleanliness Service Less Was this review helpful? Yes Problem with this review? Ask Natasha T about Hotel Panama Garden This review is the subjective opinion of a TripAdvisor member and not of TripAdvisor LLC Andrew A Lowestoft, United Kingdom 1 review “Noisy Rooms R Us” Reviewed 26 October 2011 This is a nice looking little Hotel (for Rome) and the staff were pleasant enough, except one blond lady on reception. But the problem was that our room (no. 110) was on the ground floor next to a kitchen, which is crazy for a room they are offering as a family room. We were kept awake with noises from the reception area etc and early as 6am with clatterings from the kitchen. The kitchen staff seemed to have no thought that the room was next door. We complained and were told that the only other room would be just as noisy due to traffic. We were not offered a refund or discount. I would NOT stay here again and reccomend others to avoid. Stayed October 2011, travelled with family Value Location Sleep Quality Rooms Cleanliness Service Less Was this review helpful? Yes Problem with this review? Ask Andrew A about Hotel Panama Garden This review is the subjective opinion of a TripAdvisor member and not of TripAdvisor LLC bbostock Sussex, England Reviewer 4 reviews 1 helpful vote “A very pleasant stay” Reviewed 11 October 2011 1 person found this review helpful We stayed 5 nights here, and enjoyed it very much. Like all hotels, there are some things that are less than perfect, and the Panama Garden is no exception. On the plus side we thought the staff were very friendly and helpful. We never came across any member of staff who was too busy to help or seemed surly. The location is out of the centre, but once you get to know the area, we were pleased to get away from the madness of central Rome. The walk across the Borghese park is fantastic and we often choose to walk back rather than get a bus or tram. Having said that make sure you pick up a bus route map, because without it, you will get confused. The bedroom was very clean and comfortable, and spacious enough for us. We got to the hotel via the airport bus and then local bus 86, which was fine. (But we booked a car back to the airport for €45 which I think was good value and made life a lot easier). On the negative side, the shower cubicle leaked and this was a bit annoying until I figured out how to plug the gap in the screen. And the shower head had seen better days. But there was also a bath which worked fine. The room suffered a bit from road noise, but I doubt that you could find anywhere in Rome that doesn't have some road noise. And living in deepest sussex, we are a bit spoilt. Finally we thought the breakfast suffered a bit due to the poor quality bread rolls they provide. If you have a sweet tooth you will probably be very happy, but we like a savoury breakfast that can sustain us for a few hours to lunch and we had some really beautiful bread when eating out so it was disappointing to see tiny tasteless rolls on the breakfast table. I would certainly stay at this hotel again and am happy to recommend it. Stayed October 2011, travelled as a couple Value Location Sleep Quality Rooms Cleanliness Service Less Was this review helpful? Yes Problem with this review? Ask bbostock about Hotel Panama Garden This review is the subjective opinion of a TripAdvisor member and not of TripAdvisor LLC KazHa London Senior Reviewer 8 reviews 21 helpful votes “Perfect for what I needed” Reviewed 19 September 2011 5 people found this review helpful The first thing I should say is that I really enjoyed my 4 night stay at Hotel Panama Garden. I'd be lying if I said that the hotel was anything other than basic (but very clean) in terms of comfort and general exterior/interior and it's a fair way from the city centre. But it really all depends on what you are after from a hotel. I was very happy to be situated half an hour's walk from the city with a LOVELY walk through the beautiful park that is Villa Borghese every day. I loved starting and ending my days here away from the hustle and bustle of the main tourst attaractions. I didn't actually get on one bus the whole time I stayed as I just didn't want to miss out on my peaceful walk through the park! The friendliness and helpfulness of the staff was nothing short of 5 star. I had read a couple of reviews on this site about asking for a room with a terrace but as I had only paid a very basic rate on an internet deal and I'd only read this the night before travelling, I didn't really hold out much hope. However, I was very pleasantly surprised on arrival that the lovely Naomi had gone out of her way to get me a terrace. Ideal for resting the weary legs with a nice glass of wine and watching the sun go down at night or having breakfast before heading off in the morning. The staff were also very helpful in looking into tours for me before I came out and I was looking for something a little more unusual than the average as I had already been to Rome before. Again, Naomi was very patient and looked into a number of different options for me. Room service was a bit hit and miss. If I had one criticism it would be this. I suppose that most people that come to Rome come as a couple and spend their evenings at restaurants but as I was travelling on my own I spent 2 nights in the hotel and although there is a bar menu it is very limited and on the second night I was told that there was nothing at all to eat!! And this was only at 8pm!! This was a bit of a worrry as there is very little nearby in terms of restaurants. But the staff being as lovely as they are managed to rustle me something up in the end which suited me fine. All in all, I would recommend this hotel mainly because I felt like more of a local than a tourist! The hotel felt a bit more like a home than some faceless luxury hotels and I felt like I'd become best friends with the owners of the local pizzeria by the end of my stay! Go for it if you are looking for great value for money in a city that it seriously expensive (and this is coming from a Londoner!) Room Tip: Ask for a terrace! There's no additional cost but it makes a whole big difference to your stay! See more room tips Stayed August 2011, travelled solo Value Location Rooms Service Less Was this review helpful? Yes Problem with this review? Ask KazHa about Hotel Panama Garden This review is the subjective opinion of a TripAdvisor member and not of TripAdvisor LLC alibrown85 Hull 2 reviews 5 helpful votes “Great staff and facilities” Reviewed 14 September 2011 5 people found this review helpful We stayed here in August 2011 and it was fantastic. The welcome of the staff and the gardens made us feel instantly welcome. The location was great, this has been subject to criticism from other travellers but it was a short bus ride to the centre and well connected to Termini for the train to the airport if needed. Rooms are a little small but for the price an location this is easily forgiven. I would be very surprised to find a better deal in Rome, given the factors of price against convenience. Special note should go to Noemi who was superb with us throughout, dealing with any queries we had. I wouldn't hesistate in recommended this hotel to anyone, when we return to Rome we will be sure to stay here again Stayed August 2011, travelled as a couple Value Location Rooms Service Less Was this review helpful? Yes Problem with this review? Ask alibrown85 about Hotel Panama Garden This review is the subjective opinion of a TripAdvisor member and not of TripAdvisor LLC 1-10 of 160 reviews « 1 2 ... 16 » Rome Hotels with similar traveller ratings NH Vittorio Veneto Ranked #324 Augusta Lucilla Palace Ranked #325 Hotel Panama Garden Ranked #326 BEST WESTERN Hotel Mondial Ranked #327 Domus Julia Ranked #328 Travellers who viewed Hotel Panama Garden also viewed Hotel Morgana 598 Reviews Rome, Lazio Eurostars Roma Aeterna

Reviews.Title: “Nice but far away.”
Reviews.Author: Goat74
Reviews.Content: For a short break, too much time spent walking to bus stops etc. Staff are very friendly and eager to help but their snack bar is frozen foods r us. Room had a smell of dampness and the shower was a trickle. Also, no spoons to stir your tea/coffee which is bizarre. We transferred using Terravision for €16 return for two adults which was good but a little bit ryanairish. Overall, I would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here, I want to keep it a secret!!”
Reviews.Author: Ceptics
Reviews.Content: What can I say, 5 nights of awesome service, good breakfast, nice room, good safe, not surrounded by hustle and noise, 3 min walk to catch the bus to the city, and 5 mins to get a tram to the vatican. Must thank Naomi and Co for all there help, we loved it!!

Reviews.Title: “Brigite Badrdot also stay here”
Reviews.Author: Mircea M
Reviews.Content: We was in octomber 2006 , verry peceaful hotel , nice terrace , close to the tramvai station ( number 19 ) , to reach the Vatican City. Leave the car at the hotel. It s better to walk to the downcenter with the bus. ( 4 euros a card for a walking day with all trasports , maybe now it s a little expensive , 6 E maybe ). Our room was very small , but with a nice bathroom , and a verry big terrace ( balcony ). It s good for romantic trip , but also for business travel . In 2006 our daughter staying at home. I can say nothing for a family. Very helpfull staff , with advices for your journey . I recomended this hotel .

Reviews.Title: “Quiet means distance”
Reviews.Author: kt13glos
Reviews.Content: I was offered this hotel through a deal with Air Miles in August. I was told it was in a quiet area of the City which seemed like a good idea because I was going with my 66 year old mother. However it meant we had to take the bus to anything and everything. She found the walk back from the bus stops back to the hotel at the end of each busy day quiet hard going. The main bus stops are only ten or fifteen minutes away and the tram stop for the Vatican is about 20 minutes walk but you do feel like you miss out on the City-vibe a bit. The hotel was very clean and the staff were really kind and helpful. The only reason to hestiate to book is if someone in your group has limited walking ability but otherwise it is pleasant place.

Reviews.Title: “My 18th in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Natasha T
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I, stayed in panama for 3 nights during our long weekend trip to Rome for my birthday. The hotel is very homely, the room, although a little small was cosy and had everything that we needed. The small balcony felt really italian and the view of the surrounding streets were a nice touch. The bathroom, also very small, was nicely furnished and very clean. Our towels were changed daily. There is a safe in the room and free wi-fi which we found useful. The breakfast was exactly what we needed to set up for the day, I'd recommend getting the breakfast as there isn't really any breakfast restaurants nearby, although there are some lovely places to have dinner. The location of the hotel is absolutely perfect! A very short and easy bus ride to the centre of Rome, it's only 1Euro and we found it much easier than organising a cab. Ask the hotel for a map and you will be well on your way. We also took the tram to the Vatican, which obviously took longer and was a little more complicated, but still easy enough to get to...remember to cover up! There's a delicious local restaurant by the bus stop, which we went to on my birthday, prices are reasonable and the locals all go there - proof that it's good. The Hotel is within walking distance to the Bourghese gardens and gallery, a beautiful park, also with a zoo, which we both thought was better than London zoo. Would recommend the hotel transfer service to and from the airport, we arrived at FCO without arranging transport and ended up paying 60Euros to the hotel, we travelled on a hot minibus with a crazy and dangerous driver! On the way home (:() we chose to use the hotel's private car, and travelled to the airport in a slightly more stylish, air-conditioned Mercedes, it is something like 40Euros on the way home and 50 on the way there, very very worth it. There is also a new Gym in the hotel, something we would have used if we were staying there longer. Had an all round lovely trip, it was the perfect birthday present and when we return to Rome, which I'm sure we will, we'd definitely stay at Panama again.

Reviews.Title: “A very pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: bbostock
Reviews.Content: We stayed 5 nights here, and enjoyed it very much. Like all hotels, there are some things that are less than perfect, and the Panama Garden is no exception. On the plus side we thought the staff were very friendly and helpful. We never came across any member of staff who was too busy to help or seemed surly. The location is out of the centre, but once you get to know the area, we were pleased to get away from the madness of central Rome. The walk across the Borghese park is fantastic and we often choose to walk back rather than get a bus or tram. Having said that make sure you pick up a bus route map, because without it, you will get confused. The bedroom was very clean and comfortable, and spacious enough for us. We got to the hotel via the airport bus and then local bus 86, which was fine. (But we booked a car back to the airport for €45 which I think was good value and made life a lot easier). On the negative side, the shower cubicle leaked and this was a bit annoying until I figured out how to plug the gap in the screen. And the shower head had seen better days. But there was also a bath which worked fine. The room suffered a bit from road noise, but I doubt that you could find anywhere in Rome that doesn't have some road noise. And living in deepest sussex, we are a bit spoilt. Finally we thought the breakfast suffered a bit due to the poor quality bread rolls they provide. If you have a sweet tooth you will probably be very happy, but we like a savoury breakfast that can sustain us for a few hours to lunch and we had some really beautiful bread when eating out so it was disappointing to see tiny tasteless rolls on the breakfast table. I would certainly stay at this hotel again and am happy to recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for what I needed”
Reviews.Author: KazHa
Reviews.Content: The first thing I should say is that I really enjoyed my 4 night stay at Hotel Panama Garden. I'd be lying if I said that the hotel was anything other than basic (but very clean) in terms of comfort and general exterior/interior and it's a fair way from the city centre. But it really all depends on what you are after from a hotel. I was very happy to be situated half an hour's walk from the city with a LOVELY walk through the beautiful park that is Villa Borghese every day. I loved starting and ending my days here away from the hustle and bustle of the main tourst attaractions. I didn't actually get on one bus the whole time I stayed as I just didn't want to miss out on my peaceful walk through the park! The friendliness and helpfulness of the staff was nothing short of 5 star. I had read a couple of reviews on this site about asking for a room with a terrace but as I had only paid a very basic rate on an internet deal and I'd only read this the night before travelling, I didn't really hold out much hope. However, I was very pleasantly surprised on arrival that the lovely Naomi had gone out of her way to get me a terrace. Ideal for resting the weary legs with a nice glass of wine and watching the sun go down at night or having breakfast before heading off in the morning. The staff were also very helpful in looking into tours for me before I came out and I was looking for something a little more unusual than the average as I had already been to Rome before. Again, Naomi was very patient and looked into a number of different options for me. Room service was a bit hit and miss. If I had one criticism it would be this. I suppose that most people that come to Rome come as a couple and spend their evenings at restaurants but as I was travelling on my own I spent 2 nights in the hotel and although there is a bar menu it is very limited and on the second night I was told that there was nothing at all to eat!! And this was only at 8pm!! This was a bit of a worrry as there is very little nearby in terms of restaurants. But the staff being as lovely as they are managed to rustle me something up in the end which suited me fine. All in all, I would recommend this hotel mainly because I felt like more of a local than a tourist! The hotel felt a bit more like a home than some faceless luxury hotels and I felt like I'd become best friends with the owners of the local pizzeria by the end of my stay! Go for it if you are looking for great value for money in a city that it seriously expensive (and this is coming from a Londoner!)

Reviews.Title: “Great staff and facilities”
Reviews.Author: alibrown85
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in August 2011 and it was fantastic. The welcome of the staff and the gardens made us feel instantly welcome. The location was great, this has been subject to criticism from other travellers but it was a short bus ride to the centre and well connected to Termini for the train to the airport if needed. Rooms are a little small but for the price an location this is easily forgiven. I would be very surprised to find a better deal in Rome, given the factors of price against convenience. Special note should go to Noemi who was superb with us throughout, dealing with any queries we had. I wouldn't hesistate in recommended this hotel to anyone, when we return to Rome we will be sure to stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Retro Gem in Quiet Chic Location”
Reviews.Author: eurosandbaht
Reviews.Content: We stayed here at the start of our Italy travels and then again at the end. Both stays were lovely. Great Staff. Good Breakfast. We LOVED the location- which is not at all near The Spanish Steps or any of those tourist sites. The streets in this section of The City were filled with locals and with embassy folks. Nice little restaurants. Great Prices. Best of all- when we wanted to see The Vatican, or Villa Borghese- it was all just a short bus ride away.

Reviews.Title: “good”
Reviews.Author: Travel_D0ct0r
Reviews.Content: it's all good here. All staff are helpful, in particular Naomi.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: Bow021
Reviews.Content: Thanks to advice on trip advisor we e mailed the hotel and asked for a room with a terrace overlooking the gardens. They replied immediately and duly on arrival we were given 501, the lift was very handy! it wasn't the biggest room but had a small hall leading to the bathroom so we didn't feel cramped in any way - in fact we loved it. every morning we could sit out with a coffee before breakfast (take a travel kettle)and on returning from a day walking and sightseeing we could relax in the sun with a glass of wine - brilliant. The location was great for we were out of the city but with a 16 euro bus pass for the week we could get everywhere quite easily on buses,trams etc and the hotel staff were so helpful, especially booking the Borghese gallery for us, they were always very polite and friendly, all of them. The whole place was very clean and the garden for breakfast very pretty( mosquitoes were the only problem so be prepared). We ate there sometimes for light meals in the evening and the food was ok. The deli on the main road near the 63 bus stop great for sit in lunch but was shut on Saturday. Even the ice cream shop and supermarket were close by. We would definitely return to this welcoming hotel. We loved the city and the only expensive mistake was the overnight train from Paris - dreadfully cramped and very expensive for food. Again advice to book the Vatican before the holiday and get tickets from the Forum for the Colosseum was useful, as the queues at the Colosseum were huge. If you teach as we do don't forget GTC card as you get discount.

Reviews.Title: “ideal”
Reviews.Author: Morrisllandaff
Reviews.Content: A lovely hotel. Some way out of Rome centre, but opposite a lovely park and only 400m or so from the wonderful Catacombs of Priscilla on Via Salaria, an amazing insight into the early church. The hotel offered a quiet and small, personal base. We had one room for a couple and two small kids aged 7 and 8; Air Con was greatly appreciated in the heat of the city and the room spacious, clean, attractive and comfortable. The garden of the hotel gave us a welcome place to chill out as a family in the evening and play cards. Breakfast was plentiful and of great quality. The staff could not have been more helpful. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Stay Elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: canadatraveller72
Reviews.Content: Room is very small, even by Italian standards. The front desk lady (blonde) is a snotty and arrogant jerk. When she asked my wife for her feedback, my wife mentioned that the hotel should get educated on the "Roma Pass" so they can offer it to guests. The lady starts justifying why this pass that she has never heard of is not of value. By the way, get the Roma Pass as it will make transportation by city transit and entrance to all attractions much cheaper. This hotel is far from any train station or airport. It is a 70 euro cab ride to the hotel from the airport. The breakfast is 13 euros per person. Skip it and go to the bakery down the street. Lots of parking is available. The weight room is small but has everything you need for cardio and weights.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful welcome”
Reviews.Author: mietteAuckland
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I were charmed by the graciousness of the staff at this very relaxing hotel, well located for visiting most of the main attractions of Rome. The room was beautifully decorated with that Italian flair that is all too often lacking except in the most expensive hotels. The bedroom was not large but being on the top floor, it opened on to an expansive private terrace with a table and chairs where we could write postcards and enjoy a drink in the late afternoon while looking over the park of the Villa Ada opposite. After extended travel in Italy, with, I am sad to say, many negative experiences, it was a wonderful way to finish our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay at this hotel - highly recommended!”
Reviews.Author: cjrb88
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a quad room at Hotel Panama Garden for 3 nights in late June 2011, and we were very happy with our stay there. The price was great compared to a lot of other hotels we'd looked at, the rooms were very clean, the linens were of high quality, the beds were comfortable, and it was so nice to have air conditioning in our room after long days out sightseeing in Rome! The front desk staff, Luca and Naomi, were very helpful answering any of our questions, arranging taxis from the airport, recommending restaurants, and were a great help in figuring out which buses and trams to take to various tourist attractions in Rome. Other reviews I'd read about this hotel stated that it was a bit far from the city center, but we thought it was in a great location. Very nice and safe neighborhood, and it was a pleasant ~30 minute walk down nice streets to get to the center of Rome. There are multiple bus and tram stops right around the hotel that can take you to all the typical tourist attractions (i.e. Coliseum, Vatican, etc.) within 10 minutes. I highly recommend this hotel and will stay there for all my future visits to Rome!

Reviews.Title: “Most Charming!"”
Reviews.Author: HarrisTVincent
Reviews.Content: A really charming little hotel. Staff is great (especially front desk ) and service excellent. Just out of the way enough from busy downtown Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, away from the action”
Reviews.Author: TigersLovePepper
Reviews.Content: The receptionists were helpful, the rooms are adequate, and the garden area out front was relaxing. The only issue with this hotel is its location. It is in a very nice neighborhood and really close to some interesting catacombs. However, it is not in the center of town and in order to get to any sites you must take a bus or other means of transport. It is about 3km from the main train station.

Reviews.Title: “The Staff was Awesome!!!”
Reviews.Author: Mimilouwho
Reviews.Content: Very clean with extremely helpful and friendly staff.The rooms are a bit small but with all to do in Rome who needs huge rooms.The lovely sitting rooms and front garden made up for any space you might be lacking in the room.The breakfast buffet with fresh foods and hot delicious coffee was great. Sitting on the back patio enjoying breakfast was a great way to spend our morning planning our days activities. We will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “No reason to come”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Hotel is away from the center. It takes more than half an hour by bus. No special value in small rooms and staff. We had a room in corridor style. Beds are one after the other. No better than average hostel

Reviews.Title: “very nice”
Reviews.Author: philAdelaide
Reviews.Content: A real nice hotel with first class service, room was very good real clean with a comfy bed The staff were always helpfull. in a very quite location Situated a little out of Rome but not hard to get bus service which the staff will gladly show you where [ we tried taxis and they rip you off 40 euros for a 15 minute ride] All in all a very pleasant stay

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, excellent service, great breakfast, small bedroom”
Reviews.Author: Blueskip
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay here, despite the smallness of the room which did make life a bit awkward. However, the staff were excellent and really helpful, the buffet breakfast fantastic (great selection), the sitting and dining rooms had the feel of a former grand & large family home which gave it some historical character. It was in a pleasant location next to the very large Villa Ada park and a bus or tram ride out of the centre. (The park itself is surrounded by walls on the Hotel side so you can't see into it - but it's a lovely place to walk.) Buffet Breakfast: help yourself from cereals, fruit juices (even a fresh carrot/ orange/ lemon juice - delicious!), bread rolls, toast, croissants - plain and with several types of fillings (custard, jam, chocolate, etc), cold meats, cheese, jams, marmalades, chocolate spread, fresh fruit, tinned fruit in juice, yoghurts, even cheesecake! This is also the first hotel I have ever stayed in (out of Western Europe, Canada or the US) that has been able to give me a pot of Camomile tea. We arrived late on our first evening (after 10pm) having not eaten, and asked if some food could be prepared. The staff warned that they could offer only the snack menu and normally stopped serving food at that time, but I have to say that the Lasagne we ordered from the menu was probably the best we have ever tasted! What a lovely welcome to Rome. On the room size - it was a squeeze. Likewise the bathroom. More space would have made the hotel perfect for us. However, it wasn't a deal-breaker. We had a great night's sleep. The view from the window of the villa next door and (distant) mountain beyond was lovely and we could open the windows for fresh air. Some of the features, fixtures and fittings of the building were a bit tired - mostly the original ones (of course!), but they also added character.

Reviews.Title: “OK for the money”
Reviews.Author: graveylordylasty
Reviews.Content: Just stayed at hotel, for 2 nights. Room was modern and bed comfortable but the room had a terrible smell! Hair dryer didn't work properly and could often hear water dripping, linked to the damp coming through the walls. Breakfast was basic but OK. Carpets in room and through-out hotel were worn and old, look out for the slug trails where breakfast is served! Location was fine, a bus was frequent to the centre and was a lovely walk if you felt up to it. All in all a comfortable nights sleep for a decent price but certainly not 4 star!

Reviews.Title: “Short stay vacation”
Reviews.Author: Slidesrus
Reviews.Content: Would certainly recommend this little gem of a hotel. With very helpful and friendly staff our stay in one of the executive rooms will be remembered for all the right reasons not least forgetting the jacuzzi! Close to restaurants reasonably priced and accessed hotels direct booking service with site seeing tour group for all site seeing bring picked up and dropped off from our hotel doorstep. Would suit all travellers looking for A hotel that goes just that little extra mile. Mark Eastbourne UK

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a city break”
Reviews.Author: GraceBentley
Reviews.Content: I may be being biased as I was lucky enough to be upgraded to a deluxe room, but that aside, I thought Hotel Panama was a great place to stay, especially the service we received, the people at reception spoke English to us and on arrival gave us very useful advice about trams, buses, how to get about and where everything was etc., which proved invaluable to our stay. Our room was very comfortable and the service was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place”
Reviews.Author: mb111br
Reviews.Content: the hotel has great rates and good location (quiet yet close enough to city centre although not at walking distance). Rooms are modern and clean and the service was impecable. The receptionist, Noemi, just couldn't do more for us. She put us in a lovely room and even offered to help with ironing my shirt (we had a wedding the following day). We were paying budget rates and yet getting 5 star treatment. There's also a beautiful park right across the street and a fantastic seafood restaurant nearby. If I had to find a fault, it would be the breakfast bar could have a better selection of breads and fruit juices. In short - we recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Helpful Staff, Lovely Rooms, Fairly Bad Location.”
Reviews.Author: lostreehombre
Reviews.Content: Let's get the negative out of the way: the location is pretty inconvenient. It's serviced by a nearby bus stop (services are fairly sporadic), but there's nothing of interest nearby, really, save an art gallery and cafe or two. Everything else is a positive. The staff were incredibly helpful, booking us a few taxis each day, answering idiotic questions about Rome (in perfect English), and bringing us ice for late-night wine drinking. The rooms are immaculately clean, and surprisingly good-looking--they're very modern, but not cheap-looking, and whoever renovated the place has clearly gone out of their way to retain some of the traditionalist look of the place. Breakfast was basic, but tasty, and there was a lot of it. Sleep was easy, and the obscure location of the hotel meant our room was very quiet. Wireless internet was reliable and free.

Reviews.Title: “Paper thin walls - take earplugs”
Reviews.Author: jopwales
Reviews.Content: Actually a nice hotel and a lovely room with a terrace, in a quietish location about half an hour walk to the Spanish Steps through the Villa Borhese park. Breakfast was very disappointing, no fresh juice and a limited choice, decent coffee. Room was small but with good bathroom, slightly overpowering smell of airfreshener which I thought might be disguising an unpleasant smell. Comfortable bed, but really no soundproofing at all between neighbouring rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Not a four star as claimed”
Reviews.Author: edmcmahon
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Hotel Panama Garden recently and though it calls itself a four star hotel, it lacked basic amenities like access to an iron (which the clerk at the desk said they cannot afford insurance for) which is essential when traveling. In addition, our room was SO unbelievably small, our bed incredibly hard (and I tend to like a firm bed) and the bathroom so putrid-smelling that we had to keep the door closed all the time to keep the smell from drifting into the bedroom. It also advertises itself as being in central Rome, which implies that it is close to the attractions people go there to see, but we spent an absolute fortune on taxis trying to get to the attractions it claimed to be close to. Overall we were incredibly disappointed, considering we spent $750 for three nights' stay. We'd have moved but were in Rome for such a short time that we decided to stick it out, but it put a real damper on an otherwise nice time in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Dont hesitate”
Reviews.Author: Chis1947
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my daughter, would certainly go back, the staff, especially on reception are brilliant, Thank you so much.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant room with a balcony terrace, away from the city centre”
Reviews.Author: artemisworks
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel at the last minute while booking a trip for a long weekend in Rome en route back from the south of Italy. The hotel itself is a 15 min taxi ride (about 6km) out from the central train station in Rome, and is actually outside the city centre so bear this in mind if you prefer a more centrally located hotel! Luckily, there is a bus stop about 6 mins walk from the hotel with direct buses into the city centre (Spanish Steps, Trevi etc), the train station as well as a tram stop (about 15 mins walk away) that will take you to the Vatican (about a 45-min journey on a weekday morning). The advantage of being a little further out is just how quiet the hotel is, with a beautiful little garden outside to sit in. In fact each room is equipped with a sizeable balcony terrace with a table and chairs, which for me, was the main attraction of this hotel. The rooms are not very large, but very well furnished - the bathrooms likewise. There is a/c available and a small TV, and wifi internet is only available in public areas in the hotel, but occasionally it is possible to get a faint signal inside the room. The hotel itself is also just opposite the Villa Ada, a large park which may be pleasant for a stroll on a cooler day. All in all, our stay was a pleasant experience and we did not mind the hotel's location as we were able to make use of public transport fairly easily.

Reviews.Title: “Our Stay in a very comforable and convenient hotel”
Reviews.Author: mukuruboss
Reviews.Content: Chauffeured from airport to hotel, gained 2 hours in the day. Made very welcome and felt like home away from home. Room comfortable and not pressured in any way throughout the stay. Excursions arranged and information very good. Will gladly stay here again. Breakfasts a real treat as well as the room services

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Dida_69
Reviews.Content: We decided last minute to do a road trip to Rome as were staying in La Spezia approx 4 hours away, we did not prebook anything and decided to wait until we got there. We drove into Rome and found Hotel Panama Garden with a garage for our car and the most helpful staff. We had a great time and would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel, very helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Soulstress
Reviews.Content: Me and my 12 year old bro stayed here for a week. Lovely room, breakfast was continental and not bad and the staff were friendly and helpful. It is a 45minute walk to the walls of rome, so a bus is recommeneded which is very close by and takes only 15 minutes to take you to Termini where you can all buses from and tubes etc. Lovely holiday in Rome and Noemi and Martini were fab. They let you use their computer for the net if you need to, but there is a free wi fi connection. Theres no pool or gym which was a little bit of a downer as sometimes we wanted to get back and go for a swim, but the Osti lido beach is 45mins by train and gorgeous and a lovely park Villa Ada, which I went for a run in the the morning just 30 sec walk away. Glad we are here as it was lovely and quiet away from the city madness. All in all fab holiday and very lovely room we had at Panama.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, helpful service in a quiet location within a short bus ride of all the sites.”
Reviews.Author: Ezzo58
Reviews.Content: We had 5 lovely nights here. Exploring Rome each day, following the helpful advice of the lovely reception staff. My advice would be to jog or walk in the park opposite, it is the best park we saw, a real natural place to chill out after the bustle of Rome centre. The 63 bus from just down the road took us to the centre within 15 minutes. Catch it to the end stop and visit Trastevere area in the evening for a great night out. You can eat and drink until the early hours of the morning. Our room was very comfortable and quietly situated.

Reviews.Title: “PERFECT PLACE TO STAY IN ROME.”
Reviews.Author: nurse1992
Reviews.Content: I would highly recommend this hotel for those people who plan to visit Rome, very accessible for public transports. The hotel itself is situated in a very quiet place, buffet breakfast is great..... Luca the receptionist are so wonderful and very helpful together with the rest of the hotel staff.

Reviews.Title: “Boutique Hotel in front of Villa Ada.”
Reviews.Author: billaby66
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel! It is not in the hassle but in a nice and quite area. Neverthelss in only 10 minutes you can reach the heart of the City. There is a beautifull and huge park in front of it called Villa Ada where we could run in the morning. And breakfast was served on the terrrace! Beautifull boutique Hotel; I whould definitely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, cosy hotel, we loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Motles
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at Panama Gardens for 3 nights at the end of Feb. We read quite a few reviews before booking and this had the most positive reviews for a hotel within this price range. The distance form the city centre is the only thing that put us off. However, we ended up really enjoying being slightly outside the hustle and bustle. After a days sight seeing it was so relaxing to come back to a friendly face on reception, an immaculate room and lovely sun filled balcony. There is not a great deal of restaurants / bars in close priximity to the hotel but plenty of convenience shops should you need anything. We walked pretty much everywhere and it took 30-40 minutes max. There was so much to see on the way and you can walk through the lovely park to the other side of town. For those not so keen on walking, the buses were easy to figure out, cheap and frequent. The 2 lovely ladies on reception were more than helpful, happy to answer all of our questions and we always came back to a smiley face. We would definitely recommend Panama Garden hotel and we will be sure to stay here again next time.

Reviews.Title: “Simply gorgeous”
Reviews.Author: angel2345
Reviews.Content: Our friends stayed at the Panama last year and they had such nice memories of the hotel, that we decided to book it for our short holiday too. We are a family of 5, and we asked for a family room. Even if they didn’t have connecting room, we had 2 rooms next to each other, and we also had a very nice balcony that overlooked to the park just in front! We were really satisfied, the staff is excellent, everyone is so kind, helping and smiling... First we were worried not to be in the city center, but then we realised that it is very well connected, so we started appreciating the silence of this residential area, instead of the noisy city center! We really had a good time and would like to recommend this hotel, it is a very good choice, and booking it months before you can have very convenient prices...

Reviews.Title: “Cute and Cosy!”
Reviews.Author: Adele25
Reviews.Content: We spent four nights at Hotel Panama Garden and had a wonderful time. The Hotel is situated in the north of Rome, in a classy neighbourhood which felt very safe; walking around at night was never a problem. It is about a twenty minute walk away from the city centre and there are regular buses too. I can recommend getting the number 19 tram to the Vatican and the number 92 bus to the station. Both stops are within a five minute walk from the hotel. Although small, our room was well decorated, cosy and the bathroom was huge. The staff were very friendly and gave us a map with all the local bus routes etc marked on for us. I would recommend anyone going to Rome for a few nights to stay at the Hotel Panama Garden. (And Bridget Bardot stayed there!)

Reviews.Title: “definately not 4 star”
Reviews.Author: sueyeovil
Reviews.Content: clean and comfortable, very quite, but small rooms that need updating, old style TV with only sky news in English, very basic breakfast out of town but easy to get to all the attractions using buses so not a problem we got this through airmiles so dont know how much it would cost, I would have been disappointed if I had paid thinking it was 4 star hotel - ok if looing for 3 star only frozen food available from room service, and drinks expensive

Reviews.Title: “We Love This Hotel”
Reviews.Author: haggertyann
Reviews.Content: We just spent two weeks at the Panama Garden Hotel in Rome and we loved it!!! Everything about this hotel was fabulous. We loved the room, beautiful view and the beds were perfect after a long day of touring Rome. The staff was exceptional, always anticipating your needs, especially Ruby at the front desk. The garden and terrace were gorgeous too. Very peaceful and relaxing to come "home" to. I would highly recommed this hotel to anyone staying in Rome. I can't wait till our next trip to Rome so we can visit the Panama Hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Never again”
Reviews.Author: meyfi
Reviews.Content: the hotel was not served into the last 10 years. not acceptable. small, old, loud and dirty. also the breakfast was absolutly poor. single bed room for over 100 euro with this standard - never again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, correct price.”
Reviews.Author: Malina_9
Reviews.Content: I really loved this hotel. It's very cosy, very stylish decorated - both the loby and the room. It's not very recently renovated, but well conserved. Friendly staff. The area is really nice, quite, a lot of trees around. There are bus and trams stations at about 10 minutes waliking from the hotel. I would very much recommend it. As we reserved the room 3 months before, we also got a good tariff.

Reviews.Title: “Confortable and convenient hotel at reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: ogallego
Reviews.Content: The room was spacious and comfortable, breakfast convenient and the staff friendly and really helpful. This hotel is a compromise between value and location, because the quality of the service is right up to the 4-stars standards. The hotel is 30 minutes walking distance from the Spanish steps, however, the public transport service is very convenient: Termini station: 3 minutes walking to the bus stop and 15-20 minutes commute City centre (Foro Imperial/Romano): 3 minutes walking to the bus stop and 20 minutes commute Vatican City: 6 minutes waling to the tram stop and 25 minutes commute. Please note all services run 8-0:00 and that there are night services. Please note there are several restaurants, convenient shops and ice cream shops at walking distance from the hotel. The hotel terrace and balcony are marvelous places to chill-out after a complete day. I would recommend anyone both for business (Internet connection is pretty good) or leisure.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel ,great rate and friendley staff!”
Reviews.Author: vedis
Reviews.Content: I stayed at hotel Panama in january ,been booked by the company for a bussiness trip i was not expecting a so good ,clean friendley and good quite located hotel .A good buffet breakfast in the morning a large double bed for singleroom with free internet access and free sky sport channels to see the champion soccer matches in the evening .What you need more? I hope to be back if in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “You don't get what you are paying for.”
Reviews.Author: daisysky_8
Reviews.Content: The night we arrived to the hotel we were supposed to get quadruple room which was stated we've got... If you can imagine motel 6 smallest room with queen size bed, and in addition to that two!! twin beds that were squeezed together and a living space of 1 foot between those beds, you would have a very clear idea of Panama Garden Hotel rooms that are located on the 5th floor! Add to that temperature of 94 dergees inside and you have it complete. I was slighlly puzzled when we were offerred to keep our luggage in the lobby for the duration of our stay, but the minute we've got to the elevator that doesn't allow more than 2 people at a time due to its size and the space in the room, I came to understanding of that offer.... I have never been claustrofobic, but I think I have a better understanding of it after been in that elevator. Airconditioner wasn't working, bathtub was leaking every drop of water to the floor, the bathroom smelled of sewer.... It was awfull!!!!! After multiple complaints to the front desk, we were moved, on our last day, to the room that you see on the website............ I've been to many places and hotels, and I would say that this hotel with its "hospitality" is eliminated from my places of interest forever. I like to get what I am paying for.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal Romantic Hotel nested in residential area of Rome”
Reviews.Author: jlaw1978
Reviews.Content: WOW! I was impressed for a three star hotel; this hotel was better than most 4 stars hotel we stayed during our trip. We stayed at this hotel one night in a triple room. This hotel had new stylish and trendy furniture in the lobby and was nested in a quiet upscale residential neighbourhood. The room was very clean with mini bar at price that was reasonable. Satellite TV, Room service with good menu at very reasonable price. The room was newly decorated. The Breakfast was good. The staff was helpful and spoke perfect English. We stayed at this hotel at the end of our trip and were really glad we did as we were extremely tired.Great experience. The Hotel is not located on the Subway line. Its one bus away from Termini (Bus 86 or 92).Its a little bit of a walk with luggage from the bus stop to the hotel but the hotel makes it all worth it! I would really recommend for couple looking for a quiet time.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: riknroz
Reviews.Content: My husband and I loved our stay! Our room was just as it was pictured on the website. The front desk staff spoke English and went above and beyond. And although it was a bit far from the main attractions, a 10 minute bus ride took you to the center of all the action. The bus stop was a convenient 5 blocks away. There was free wireless internet in the rooms and the breakfast was typical Italian...breads, cheese, turkey, yogurt, some fruit, and coffee. The only drawback for us was that they advertised an "American Restaurant ." Well, that restaurant consists of a room service menu with pizza, pasta, and drinks. There is no restaurant to sit and order. However, if you sit outside in the garden, they will bring the food out to you. It's more like a hidden snack bar than a restaurant. I asked the receptionist about shuttle service to the airport and she told me that there was a flat fee of 58 euros. However, I did research in the Internet and found a service for as low as 45 euros. Try Rome Shuttle Limousine. Overall, a great stay in a parklike area.

Reviews.Title: “peaceful location”
Reviews.Author: docrjj
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely old hotel with a great staff, nice rooms (ours had a small balcony overlooking a garden), and very good breakfast. It is a little farther away from some of the great parts of Rome, like ancient Rome and the Vatican, but the tradeoff is a larger room for less money, a truly wonderful staff, and a more peaceful location, near beautiful parks. We would walk in the AM when it was still cooler and we were energetic, then take a taxi back. Since there were four of us, this wasn't even too expensive. I would definitel recommend this hotel for peace-seekers!

Reviews.Title: “bonjourna roma”
Reviews.Author: CorkJoe
Reviews.Content: panama garden hotel April 19-24 -07 we enjoyed an excellent stay at the above hotel, we found the staff both helpful and extreme courteous. The hotel while a distance from the center of Rome, was easily accessible by both bus and tram. The room while small had a balcony with patio furniture, and we enjoyed very nice evenings there. Locally there are very good restaurants and bars both serving very good and inexpensive food. The hotel also has a lovely garden, where guests can enjoy a leisurely drink or even a coffee. This combined with very good staff made our stay very enjoyable, we would have no hesitation recomending it to our friends.

Reviews.Title: “Great value hotel”
Reviews.Author: CitybreakloverUK
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel for our first wedding anniversary and found it suited our needs very well. The room was small but spotlessly clean, and the decor was pleasant. The bathroom was a good size with a powerful shower, toiletries provided and nice big fluffy towels. The hotel is situated in a quiet, upmarket suburb of Rome near the Villa Borghese. Taxis to and from the centre cost between 6 (Termini station) and 12 euros (Travastere) - not 35 euros as one reviewer states (one imagines this wasn't an official taxi - common sense is sometimes required!) A variety of buses run from a stop about five minutes walk away from the hotel and take about fifteen minutes to reach the main historical centre - so pretty convenient. Staff were pleasant and helpful and the breakfast was very good, a huge range of pastries, bread, cheese, ham and fruit (and, strangely, cake!). There is a pleasant garden one can breakfast in - just ask the waiters to open the doors. All in all, great value (we paid 99 euros per night, the rack rate is higher).

Reviews.Title: “Rip Off Rome!”
Reviews.Author: Anita23
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 5 night stay at the Panama Garden Hotel. The bedroom was tiny - and this was the Superior Room. I dread to think how small it would have been had we gone for the Standard Room! The room service menu was very small however we were tired from travelling when we arrived and decided to eat in. Firstly we ordered some sandwiches and some pasta. The barman called the room to tell us that they had no ham! So we received two tiny cheese sandwiches priced @ €2.50 each. Also the lasagne was lukewarm and obviously microwaved despite the half hour wait for the food to arrive. We availed of the complimentary airport pickup but had to wait an hour after our scheduled pick up time for the driver to arrive. The worst part was our departure: we asked the receptionist to order us a taxi to the airport. It is only a 15 minute drive Ciampino Airport however when we got there the driver demanded €58! I rang the hotel to query this as it seemed an extortionate amount. The receptionist advised me that this was the correct charge as it was a 'Limousine service'! As we had asked for a taxi ( though what the difference is I don't know as the car was not a limo!) I asked him how much a taxi would cost? He said he didn't know. He was impatient to get off the phone and was extremely unhelpful. I asked a nearby taxi driver what the standard charge for the same journey was and he replied €20! What irritated me most is that the hotel ordered this 'Limousine Service' for us when we just asked for a taxi! Never again!

Reviews.Title: “A haven”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: 4 of us stayed for 3 nights in this lovely hotel. The centre of Rome was extremely hot and it was a delight to return after our exhausting but exhilarating days to the cool, peaceful Panama Garden. We slept so soundly, as it was such a quiet location at night. The staff are very helpful and friendly and gave us excellent advice on nearby restaurants and transport. The tram is close by for Vatican City and the buses frequent and easy to take you into the centre and to Termini to catch the metro. We took a trip out to Tivoli to the gardens and fountains - a good 3 hour round trip but very easy and very cheap on their transport system. An escape from the humid City at this time of year. Breakfast can be taken in the pretty and sheltered garden at the rear. This is excellent value for money and we will recommend to anyone who wants to see the wonderful sights of Rome. If you happen to eat in the recommended Pizzaria, second corner on the left, down the stairs (the reception will tell you), ask for Gino the Chef there, who will make you up a few treats. Very inexpensive.

Reviews.Title: “Take your hiking boots”
Reviews.Author: Go See
Reviews.Content: The Panama is a quiet hotel, in a quiet part of Rome, the staff are friendly and cater for english speaking guests. Continental breakfast is adequate, with a good range on offer, served on an airy patio. Rooms while clean and comfortably furnished are however the smallest we have ever stayed in anywhere in the world! We class ourselves as keen walkers but this hotels location is most certainly not convenient for Romes main attractions. With public transport links around 500mts away and the travel time into the "termini" about 15min you will waste a lot of your time getting to/from Rome. PS Don't be tempted to get a taxi they are extortionate @ c.35 Euros to the centre, get a travel pass and mingle with the locals!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My sister and I have just spent a wonderful long weekend in Rome and we couldn't have choosen a better place to stay. The check in process was quick and efficient, just what we needed after a long delay at the airport. Our room was clean and airy, with a view of the hotel garden and two confortable single beds. Aks the hotel staff about some local restaurants, they will give you some great recomendations. The area is nice and quiet, ideal if you are looking for a place to relax after a long day of city sightseeing. I have already recomended the hotel to all my friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Never again!!”
Reviews.Author: bazzared
Reviews.Content: My new wife and I stayed here as part of our honeymoon, and booked mainly on what we'd read here. I really wish we hadn't bothered! I honestly can't see why so many people like this hotel. We checked in for 5 nights and for the first 3 were put into what must have been the worst room in Rome - barely even a single room, they told us it was a double, no room to open our suitcases, and a bed that moved like we were lying on a dinghy in the middle of the ocean! After complaining, we were moved across the corridor to a slightly more spacious room, but not before personal items from our original room had mysteriously disappeared. After a bit of persuasion to the desk that this had happened, the bellboy eventually returned with the items, but we got no apology or explanation. Also, the buffet breakfast was of poor standard and, even with the above incident aside, the staff were thoroughly miserable and unhelpful. Fortunately we decided not to hang around the hotel too much during our stay, and although it took the shine off our visit, Rome itself made up for this hotels failings. I'm not normally a person who likes to complain, but stay at this hotel at your own risk!!

Reviews.Title: “Can't recommend Panama Garden”
Reviews.Author: PaintedNails
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Panama Garden over Christmas. The hotel is clean and pleasant enough but has enough negatives that we will not use the hotel again. Firstly, the Hotels website lists many inclusive items that just don't exist. I could name them all but they are too numerous to list. The biggest complaint of what is not in the room was a coffee/tea maker. I haven't stayed in a hotel in years that did not include a coffee/tea maker in their rooms. The refrigerator in the room did not work either. This seemed to be a problem in other rooms because I heard others complain of the same thing at the front desk. Also the heat in the room could not be turned on in the daytime. They must have a central control on it because I could get no heat till 5pm. Also we could not get a cup of tea after 10:30pm at night. After walking in the cold all day and evening my husband and I asked the girl at the front desk if we could get a cup of tea. She curtly snapped "Bar is closed" and could have cared less. The dark haired girl on the front desk was very rude the entire time we stayed. We were not the only ones that found her to be. On Christmas Eve we asked for her help in getting transportation to the Vatican for midnight Mass. This dark haired girl flat out lied to us telling us there were no taxis or buses but if we left immediately we could get a trolley (this was at 9:30 pm). We hurried the 5 blocks to the trolley station only to find out all public transportation stopped at 7pm. Luckily a nearby hotel secured us a taxi. I wish I knew the name of that hotel because I would recommend it. Our entire stay we could not get the front desk to help us at all. When we inquired to the front desk where we could have a Christmas Day dinner we were told that everything was closed and we could go downtown and try to locate something ourselves on the day. They made no attempt to try to secure reservations for their guests. We ended up at a very poor Chinese Restaurant with two others from our Hotel also there. The internet that they say they provide access to is located behind their front desk. You would never know it was there unless you asked. When I asked for it I was told I could use it if only for a few minutes. It is a very uncomfortable place to check and send email. The rooms are so small that you cannot move around in them. Other couples there at the time asked for an upgrade but were told they could not have one. The rooms are clean but that is about all. You could spend no time in them because you would go stir crazy. The breakfast is okay if all you want is pastry.But the guy that worked the breakfast room in the morning is the grouchiest man I have ever seen. Asking for a second pot of coffee was met with such a fuss that I hated asking. He did not want to be there obviously. This hotel is very far from City Centre. You have to take a bus. Ada Park can't be seen from the hotel because there is a tall wall all around it. Be careful when walking the streets near the hotel. We constantly dodged Dog waste. Obviously no one picks up after their dog. I could go on and on but I think you get the idea about this hotel. The only thing good was we only paid 325 euro total for six nights. If I had paid any more I would have asked for my money back. Cannot recommend to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel is not nearly as good as people claim. I just checked in a few hours ago - my room is the tiniest I have ever seen, and I am an extremely frequent traveller. The hotel is a 20 minute bus ride from the center of town - no where near the city center. On this same trip, I have had far superior rooms in places like Istanbul, Bucharest, Prague, etc. Avoid this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Dont take their transfer service!”
Reviews.Author: BigD
Reviews.Content: Location: This is nowhere near the city centre as we would know it, a good 10 - 15 minute bus or taxi journey, walking it would be beyond anyone unless they were very fit, knew the routes and didnt mind dodging the traffic. Cost of taxi to centre, varied from 10 to 15 Euros depending on drop off. Nice neighbourhood, lots of local shops, restaurants etc, very safe feel and cheaper than town for dining and drinking. Bus stop about 5 minutes from Hotel, hassle getting in or out on buses unless again you know the routes etc. Staff: Fair enough, neither off hand or rude, but could be more proactive. Breakfast: Poor. No cooked food at all, small mixture of breads and smaller cereal and fruit selection. 1 sort of cheese, 2 sorts of ham, orange and water regularly ran out and took time to be refilled. Rooms: We were in the double executive superior room, 504. Nice decor, good terrace, marble bathrooms, size average, not 2 bad i guess for Rome but the other rooms were much smaller on the lower floors. Price: 172 euro per room per night, not worth it given location, could and should have got similar deal in a proper city centre hotel. Hotel Transfer service: Dont do it. Our flight left at 11.05am, it is a 30 minute drive, the hotel arranged our transfer as part of the package and told us to be ready to leave at 9am. The driver didnt come until 930am, the 30 minute drive took 55 minutes as the driver took the scenic route to CIA airport and we made it to check in 10 minutes before the desk closed, far too tight and made us very nervous as at one stage i thought we were never going to get there on time. Overall the transfer farce at the end made me reduce the rating, but i still on reflection wish i had gone for a more central venue. There is nothing particularly special in the hotel or price to make you stay here and i wont be back and if you do go back yourself, arrange your own transfers, the hotel one nearly cost us an extra day!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Over-rated do date - average 3 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: FlirtyForty
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel based on previous reviews. Was disappointed on arrival. It is important to remember that this hotel is a 3 star hotel. Reviews to date would give you an expectation of more! It is a little shabby and the 3rd floor where we stayed is definitely in need of a makeover. The room was a good size (superior double) but the bath was unusable - old and stained. On the plus side breakfast is very good and the hotel is clean. The staff are very helpful and pleasant. It is a little off the beaten track but there are plenty of buses and a taxi ride into the centre averages about €8. So in a nutshell - not bad but not fantastic. You could probably do better for the same price nearer the centre.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible staff and very poor hygiene!”
Reviews.Author: Pollydee
Reviews.Content: Hi, I am shocked in reading so positive reviews on the Panama Garden Hotel in Rome! I have been there on june 2005 for two nights. Apparently, the first impression was good enough and acceptable, except a not very professional receptionist I talked with. Well, I went in my room accompanied from one person of the reception. They had some problems with the key that did not succeed to open the door, but this was not a problem. Once in my room, the first impression was good enough, but I could very soon see that the green fitted carpet was PLENTY of white hairs and powder. Terrible! Terrible! I found a pair of hairs also in the bathroom and under the beadspread!!! But perhaps the most terrible thing was that I asked gently to the receptionist to make to pass the vacuum cleaner on the moquette ufficially "because I am allergic to the powder" and another hotel employee that listened to my demand and that was not a receptionist behind the desk took part and told me with an extremely disagreeable tone that "in the hotel the vacumm cleaner is passed every day". Well, while I made present that if I had made one demand it was because I knew what I said, the result was that finally I had the hairs of someone on the floor for all the duration of my stay. The hotel gives a good impression when you arrive, I had a first good impression too, but then I had one of my most terrible experience in a hotel in Rome, expecially for the professionality and the hygiene lack.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic little hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a week in Rome, where we had the pleasure of staying at the Panama Gardens Hotel. Having previously stopped in this area of Rome, we knew that we would have a long-ish walk to the main sights of the city, but the walk through Villa Borghese and along Via Veneto is so pleasant that it really doesn't feel so taxing. If the walk doesn't suit, however, the hotel is near to a major bus route (to city centre, sights, railway stations, etc); buses are frequent, quick and cheap, so distance from the centre was never really an issue. The hotel itself is clean, well-maintained and run by polite and friendly staff who are only too happy to help - their recommendation for Il Garagliano restaurant (5-10 minutes walk from the hotel) was fantastic and it's just a shame that we left it until the penultimate night before trying it, as it was much better than some of the restaurants we have tried in the centre of Rome. The en suite bedrooms are nicely furnished, contain tv and mini-bar and are cleaned on a daily basis. We tried two rooms, as the one we were provided with on arrival we deemed too cramped for a week's holiday (but fine for a shorter stay). The staff very helpfully showed us other rooms and let us move to a wonderfully spacious room overlooking the Villa Ada opposite the hotel. We did have to pay an upgrade for this bigger room, but it was definitely worth it for the added luxury - the fully-functioning air-con system and nice powerful shower made it a great place to come back to at the end of a hard day's shopping/sightseeing. The breakfast room was nice and spacious, offering indoor and outdoor tables. Breakfast itself was great - nice coffee and a wide selection of pastries, cereals, bread rolls, jams and fruit, all of which are kept well-stocked until the last person has had their fill. Also, breakfast is served between 06.30 and 10.30, offering the chance of a good meal before an early start, whilst allowing others to have a nice lie-in! We thoroughly enjoyed our stay and would recommend this hotel to others.

Reviews.Title: “A real find!”
Reviews.Author: darrell
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 29/08/05 for 4 days. We booked after reading the reviews here on tripadvisor. I have to say we were not dissapointed. This is an absolute gem of a hotel for the price. We arrived at 1:00am but were met by a charming gentleman on reception, smartly dressed and courteous and efficient. Some reviews mentioned that it was a long walk to the bus stop but it is about 200/300 yards at most and buses run every few minutes. The area is especially nice, with a beautiful park just opposite and the wonderful Catacombs of St. Pricilla just up the road ( about 5 mins steady walk). All in all this is an excellent base for a holiday in this remarkable city.

Reviews.Title: “a mixed bag”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Firstly, to accentuate the positive... The hotel is in an upper middle class neighborhood of Rome. The lobby has a cool Italian 60's chic about it; you half expect to catch a glimpse of Anita Ekberg strolling by (in fact, as the photo informed us, Brigitte Bardot stayed there in 1960). The breakfast was the very best of four hotels I'd experienced, served on a charming plant-lined patio. Room and bath were very clean; bathroom newly updated. The staff was reasonably helpful. The hotel is not centrally located, despite what the website claims. In fact, it's in one of Rome's more remote sections. Five minutes to the busstop, and a lengthy ride to the historic center (seemingly longer to St. Peter's). The hotel is undergoing refurbishing, and the workers were in the hallways, plaster all about them, dropcloths spread everywhere. I understand the need for updates, but where the guests walk, during peak tourist season? The room was small; the bed was too soft. Above the door, the wallpaper was clearly stained in many spots. The bathroom door locked automatically from the inside, and could then only be opened from the bedroom. The room's lights flickered dramatically whenever the main door was opened or closed. No curtains in the bathroom; blinds impossible to move. A mixed bag.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable & Quiet, bit far out”
Reviews.Author: Crispin01
Reviews.Content: Booked it based on reviews here. Staff good, quiet location as mentioned by others but it is a good 10min walk to the bus stop and then 10-15mins trip to central terminal. Walking into to the central area would be a challenge from here. Despite this I believe the location gives much better value for money quality-wise. I would recommend it if you don't mind relying on the bus or taxis. P.S do not miss a tour of the Domus Aurea (Neros palace).

Reviews.Title: “The Albergo was perfect”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: There are so many good reviews of the Hotel Panama Garden that I'm not sure that I can add anything else in that department! I echo all the good comments - staff was helpful, including making a reservation for us to the Aurea Domus and advising us on lines to the Sistine Chapel. The location was great- we walked all over the city from this central spot The rooms were immaculate and well appointed. The breakfast area is big with a beautiful garden and the food was good. If you are fortunate to go to Rome, stay here.We also were set-up with a guide recommended by Jeanluca at the hotel for a half-day to see the major sites in Rome.Ask the hotel and they will arrange it. I have trip advisor to thank for finding it in the first place and saving me from staying at the hotel I originally booked for our trip.

Reviews.Title: “Second rate hotel”
Reviews.Author: Blackdogs
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a month in Portugal,Spain and Italy..I booked the travel on the internet and had very few problems other than getting ripped off by taxis drivers everwhere.We had a great time and will more than likely return to visit Sevelle Spain and Rome at greater length..Only issues that left a bad taste was Hotel Panama Garden in Rome and a short term car rental with Auto Europe/Europcar.. I booked the room at the Hotel Panama via the internet and later learned that it was just a basic room when I thought I was getting a "balcony room overlooking the park"..OK,so I agree to another 20 Euros a night to get what I was suppose to get in the first place....When we finally get to the hotel I find that there was a mistake and the balcony is not availably until the next day and the price is now 40 euros more...Also the basic room is not available so they were kind enougth to put me in a delux room for the 20 euros I had already paid...Long story short,this place is ripoff city and just a little old dirty hotel with a staff that could'nt care if you are alive or dead,just don't ask for anything like towels,glasses or ice..Second problem,Auto Europe/Europcar.I am not going into the long details of a crappy dangerous car and getting ripped off,I"ll just say to try some other firm...All in all we had a good time and will return again.

Reviews.Title: “Awsome Experience”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: From the moment you arrive at this hotel, you know it's in a class of its own. The bellboy and reception people were great. The bathroom was all marble and big for european standards. The location was great, didn't have to worry about the noisy streets that include thousands of motocycles and cars. The staff provided us with great suggestions of where to eat nearby, and it was great. Only 2 city blocks from many buses. We found that we could walk almost everywhere if you like to walk, and if you like shopping (like me) this location was heaven, where most italians do their fashion shopping. Definitely a place I will go back.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice staff but disappointing rooms for the money”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed here on our last night in Rome in March 2005. We splurged on this expensive hotel on the outskirts of the city to relax and enjoy our last night. When we arrived, we were impressed with the lobby and the very friendly staff, but were extremely disappointed with our room. The room was dark, small, the bed was barely a full size, and overall depressing. We complained nicely to the front desk, and explained that for the amount of money we were paying, we were disappointed and asked for another room. They were full, but let us change rooms anyway, since not everyone had checked in. The new room was much better, but still not quite worth the money, in my opinion. It was small but the bathroom was nice--even had a tub with a shower--but the room seemed a bit on the old side--peeling wallpaper, etc. The staff made up for the not so great rooms, and was very helpful and friendly. One advantage was that they provided transportation to the airport, which was nice when you have an early flight.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Panama Garden
HotelInfo.Address: Via Salaria, 336, 00199 Rome, Italy
